intro: Chamaefistula tocotana, commonly known as the Tocotana bignay, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and ovate, with a glossy green surface. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its natural dispersal in the wild.
